meanings.definition: Opsins: Light-sensitive proteins found in the retina of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The opsins in the eye help us see in different lighting conditions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study opsins to understand how our eyes perceive light.
meanings.sent3: The opsins in the eye had a party and invited the cones and rods.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny light catchers, opsins capture the essence of the visual world.
meanings.sent5: The opsins danced with joy as the sunlight touched them gently.

meanings.definition: Opsins: Proteins that play a key role in the process of phototransduction.
meanings.sent1: Phototransduction relies on opsins to convert light into signals for the brain.
meanings.sent2: The opsins work tirelessly to ensure our vision functions properly.
meanings.sent3: The opsins threw a phototransduction party and invited the other proteins.
meanings.sent4: In the intricate dance of vision, opsins lead the way with grace.
meanings.sent5: The opsins whispered secrets of light to the cells around them.

meanings.definition: Opsins: Molecules that absorb light and trigger a biological response.
meanings.sent1: When light hits opsins, they start a chain reaction in the body.
meanings.sent2: Opsins are like tiny light switches that turn on biological processes.
meanings.sent3: The opsins absorbed so much light, they glowed in the dark.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness, opsins become the catalysts of life's reactions.
meanings.sent5: The opsins hummed with energy as they absorbed the sunlight.
